description:
At Google, our philosophy is build it, break it and then rebuild it better. That thinking is at the core of how we approach testing at Google. Unlike roles with similar names at the other companies, Test Engineers at Google aren't manual testers -- you write scripts to automate testing and create tools so developers can test their own code. As a Test Engineer, you navigate Google's massive codebase, identify weak spots and constantly design better and creative ways to break software and identify potential problems. You'll have a huge impact on the quality of Google's growing suite of products and services.

As an Optics Display Test Engineer on the Centralized Test Engineering team, you will manage one of the key consumer satisfaction metrics - functional performance of devices. You will be a key member of the cross-functional team that will launch the product. You will also manage factory test stations from concept to mass production.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • BS degree in Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in testing products for manufacturing. Experience of coding in Python, Matlab, or C++.
  • Experience with building and launching consumer electronics products.
  • Experience in manufacturing with a focus on DFM (design for manufacturing) and DFT (design for test). Experience with image quality evaluation and imaging science, statistical analysis, correlation and GRR.

Preferred qualifications:

  • MS/PhD in Engineering.
  • Experience with image processing and algorithm development. Experience with high volume production and test processes.
  • Experience with hardware testing, system bring up, and design validation. Experience with micro-electronics design and validation.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of Display/Optics tests in module level, sub assembly level and system level.
  • Knowledge of camera testing instruments (imaging, colorimeter, spectrometer, etc).
  • Effective project management and leadership skills within Mechanical and/or Software test station development.
responsibilities:
• Design and implement camera test solutions, test Software, yield, parametric data and correlation.
  • Understand camera Hardware and quality control. Design test algorithms to catch camera failures. Collaborate with Design/Engineering teams to define and implement functional specifications for products.
  • Make recommendations to design and test coverage improvement with minimal engineering engagement.
  • Work with infrastructure teams on test framework improvements, data collection, etc. Work with OEM, ODM, JDM, and CM partners, ensuring tests are implemented across different factories.
  • Travel internationally as required.
title: Optics Display Test Engineer, Consumer Hardware
